meanings.definition: The action of giving a misleading or false account or impression.
meanings.sent1: The distortion of facts led to confusion among the students.
meanings.sent2: The funhouse mirror created a funny distortion of my reflection.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated distortion of events made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The distortion of reality in the movie made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of distortion in the painting made it unique and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: The action of distorting or the state of being distorted.
meanings.sent1: The distortion of the image on the screen was due to a technical glitch.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph showed signs of distortion over time.
meanings.sent3: The distortion of his voice on the phone call made him sound like a robot.
meanings.sent4: The distortion of the music through the speakers made it hard to enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The heat caused a distortion in the shape of the plastic bottle.

meanings.definition: The alteration of the original form of something.
meanings.sent1: The distortion of the sculpture gave it a modern twist.
meanings.sent2: The distortion of the truth in the story changed its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The distortion of the cake's shape made it look like a funny animal.
meanings.sent4: The distortion of the map made it difficult to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The distortion of the fabric created a unique pattern on the dress.
